actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on December 10, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Ms. McClellan moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER MOTION TO DISCHARGE
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Golden (ME) notified the House of his intent to offer a motion to discharge the Committee on Rules from further consideration of H. Res. 432 pursuant to clause 2(c) of rule XV. The Chair announced that the House will entertain the gentleman's motion within two legislative days.
The House observed a moment of silence in honor of the Honorable Carolyn Cheeks Kilpatrick.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 312 — "Dismissing the election contest relating to the office of Representative from the Fourteenth Congressional District of Florida."
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 311 — "Dismissing the election contest relating to the office of Representative from the Thirtieth Congressional District of Texas."
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 310 — "Dismissing the election contest relating to the office of Representative from the at-large Congressional District of Alaska."
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 309 — "Dismissing the election contest relating to the office of Representative from the Twenty-eighth Congressional District of Texas."
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 308 — "Dismissing the election contest relating to the office of Representative from the Fourteenth Congressional District of Florida."
Mr. Steil asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 400
actions-list.actionItem: 0 (Roll no. 316).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1676 — "To amend the Pittman-Robertson Wildlife Restoration Act to require the Secretary of the Interior to approve the wildlife conservation and restoration program of a State within a certain period of time."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 399
actions-list.actionItem: 5 (Roll no. 315).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 356 — "To extend the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on motions to suspend the rules which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1372.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gill (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1372 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 300 Macedonia Lane in Knoxville, Tennessee, as the "Reverend Harold Middlebrook Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2175.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gill (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2175 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 130 South Patterson Avenue in Santa Barbara, California, as the "Brigadier General Frederick R. Lopez Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1461.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gill (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1461 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 521 Thorn Street in Sewickley, Pennsylvania, as the "Mary Elizabeth 'Bettie' Cole Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2466.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gill (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2466 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 5225 Harrison Avenue in Rockford, Illinois, as the "Jay P. Larson Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 2283.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gill (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 2283 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 201 West Oklahoma Avenue in Guthrie, Oklahoma, as the "Oscar J. Upham Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1830.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gill (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1830 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 840 Front Street in Casselton, North Dakota, as the "Commander Delbert Austin Olson Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1009.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gill (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1009 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 86 Main Street in Haverstraw, New York, as the "Paul Piperato Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1008.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gill (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 1008 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 298 Route 292 in Holmes, New York, as the "Sheriff Adrian 'Butch' Anderson Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 323.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Gill (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 323 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 80 Prospect Street in Avon, New York, as the "Officer Anthony Mazurkiewicz Memorial Post Office Building"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 5131.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Crank moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 5131 — "To extend military land withdrawals in Alaska, New Mexico, and California for a period of 25 years and to make technical corrections to descriptions for certain military land withdrawals, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4503.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Crank moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4503 — "To improve environmental reviews and authorizations through the use of interactive, digital, and cloud-based platforms, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 573.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Crank moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 573 — "To require the Council on Environmental Quality to publish an annual report on environmental reviews and causes of action based on alleged non-compliance with the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2916.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Crank moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2916 — "To authorize, ratify, and confirm the Agreement of Settlement and Compromise to Resolve the Akwesasne Mohawk Land Claim in the State of New York, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2306.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Crank moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2306 — "To reauthorize the Adams Memorial Commission, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2290.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Crank moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2290 — "To provide that the memorial to commemorate the sacrifice and service of the women who worked on the home front to support the efforts of the United States military during World War II may be located on the National Mall, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2389.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Crank moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2389 — "To take certain land in the State of Washington into trust for the benefit of the Quinault Indian Nation, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2388.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Crank moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 2388 — "To take certain Federal land in the State of Washington into trust for the Lower Elwha Klallam Tribe, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1676.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Crank moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1676 — "To amend the Pittman-Robertson Wildlife Restoration Act to require the Secretary of the Interior to approve the wildlife conservation and restoration program of a State within a certain period of time."

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Hurd (CO) objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3857.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Hurd (CO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 3857 — "To amend the Snow Water Supply Forecasting Program Authorization Act."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2293.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Hurd (CO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2293 — "To require the Secretary of the Interior to reissue certain regulations relating to the taking of double-crested cormorants at aquaculture facilities."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 655.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Hurd (CO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 655 — "To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to convey certain Federal land to the City of The Dalles, Oregon."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4285.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 4285 — "To direct the Secretary of the Interior to designate an entrance-fee free date in 2026 at National Park Service sites in order to celebrate the 250th anniversary of the United States of America."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1276.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1276 — "To remove restrictions from a parcel of land in Paducah, Kentucky."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2302.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2302 — "To take certain Federal land in the State of California into trust for the benefit of the Shingle Springs Band of Miwok Indians, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 356.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. LaMalfa moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 356 — "To extend the Secure Rural Schools and Community Self-Determination Act of 2000."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 2950.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Walberg to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Brandon Gill to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
